intro.text: Before the first sunrise, there is only silence—so complete it feels like a substance. Then a single thought appears, bright as a spark: something could exist.

first_light.text: You name it, and it answers. Light pours outward, not as a flood, but as a promise—revealing that emptiness can be measured.

first_void.text: You shape the void like a bowl, giving absence an edge. In the curve of nothing, you feel room for everything that will come.

spread.text: The light spreads until it meets itself. The first horizon forms—an idea made visible.

hold_close.text: You hold the light close, and it warms into color. In the glow, you can almost see the shapes of future worlds.

matter_invite.text: You invite matter, and the void answers with weight. Dust gathers into threads, threads into clouds, clouds into possibility.

choices.label: Ignite a star within the cloud
Let the cloud drift and learn

echo.text: You listen. The echo is faint at first—a rhythm. A heartbeat. A pattern the universe can follow.

laws.text: You set simple laws: movement, change, consequence. The cosmos becomes a story that can be continued.

star.text: A star ignites. It is lonely and magnificent. Around it, darkness becomes not an enemy—but a stage.

ending_good_worlds.text: Worlds begin. Not finished, not safe—only possible. The cosmos turns, and in its turning you recognize the oldest truth: creation is choice repeated.

ending.summary: You establish order and open the door to endless stories.

ending_ambiguous_orbit.text: You place worlds in orbit and watch them spin—beautiful, fragile, unsupervised. You’ve begun something you cannot control, and that might be the point.

ending.summary: You create life’s stage, but let it evolve without guarantees.

ending_bad_imbalance.text: You ignite a second star too close. Gravity argues. Heat rages. The first balance shatters into brilliance and ruin. Even gods can rush.

ending.summary: Creation collapses under impatience. The cosmos must restart.
